resources.string: This is for advanced users only! This screen allows you to change which keywords are hidden. These are used when an app is looking for installed packages, files on the system, and more.
This is for advanced users only! This screen allows you to change which commands are hidden. These are uses when an app tries to run other applications, such as "su" or "busybox".
DO NOT CHANGE IF YOU DO NOT UNDERSTAND WHAT THESE ARE USED FOR.
No apps. To add an app, either click the + to choose from the installed apps, or go to the menu, and then press Reset to Default Apps to use the default list.
No keywords. To add a keyword, either click the + to add one, or go to the menu, and then press Reset to Default Keywords to use the default list.
No commands. To add a command, either click the + to add one, or go to the menu, and then press Reset to Default Commands to use the default list.
Some apps in the play store do not run if they detect root. RootCloak uses a variety of methods to prevent root detection.
To use RootCloak, add the app you want to prevent from detecting root to the list using the Add/Remove Apps section.
You must REBOOT your phone for any changes to take effect!
Remember, if your device will not boot, hold the UP VOLUME to disable Cydia and all extensions! I (devadvance) am NOT responsible for any issues that may occur on your device!
